question: In which year, the Sadar Fouzdari Adalat was shifted from Calcutta to Murshidabad?
explanation: Under the Judicial Plan of 1774, the supervision of the Collector on the working of the Mofussil Fouzdari Adalats and that of the Governor and Council over the Sadar Fouzdari Adalat, came to an end. Now Sadar Fouzdari Adalat was shifted from Calcutta to Murshidabad and placed under the supervision and control of the Nawab. A new office of Haib Nazim was created who controlled the working of the Sadar Nizamat Adalat on behalf of the Nawab. Mohammad Raza Khan was appointed as Naib-Nazim.
